title: (x) NBC's new corporate typeface - SF Chaerilidae {Clay Burnett}
content:
ready, set, go...

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [hdr\_home\_nbcbroadband.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20100128115120/http:/typophile.com/files/hdr_home_nbcbroadband.gif) | 1.6 KB |
author: timfm

comments.content: NBC sure is big enough to afford a custom corporate typeface, but I'm not excluding any possibilities yet. Let's hear it from the others.
NBC Universal is part of GE. Maybe it was done by the same designer as the GE font?

I like the new nbc font and was looking for it online, ran across this...

[http://moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/shyfonts/shy\_c.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20100128115120/http:/moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/shyfonts/shy_c.htm "http://moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/shyfonts/shy\_c.htm")

i'm no expert but it's close to, if not, SF Chaerilidae
It's _very_ close -- the weight of the NBC font is slightly lighter and the ascenders and descenders are shorter, but the skeletton matches.

Me likes horsey. :^P

Good thing we're not married, Tiff -- I mean to each other: I am -- we'd never get along on all things type.
So this is your cue to go "Oh Yves, you and your quirks!" :^D
Oh Yves, you and your quirks! :^P
